content.text:
# Recent ElizaOS Updates

This summary covers recent pull requests to the ElizaOS repository, including bug fixes, new features, documentation improvements, and testing enhancements.

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed Telegram types exposure (PR #4287)
- Resolved external dependency issues (PR #4306)
- Fixed remote attestation action (PR #4305)
- Corrected GUI missing requirement indicators and tooltips after merge conflict (PR #4307)
- Fixed knowledge types (PR #4243)
- Implemented utils-based UUID for broader browser support (PR #4318)
- Fixed persistent beacon by handling tour close action (PR #4317)
- Corrected a typographical error in Character.md (PR #4313)

## New Features

- Added CLI test suite (PR #4301)
- Implemented OpenAI model usage events (PR #4230)
- Added confirmation dialog for delete group functionality (PR #4310)
- Added deleteTweet() function (PR #4320)

## Documentation and Testing

- Removed consecutive duplicate words in documentation (PR #4312)
- Added video understanding plugin tests (PR #4233)

## Other Improvements

- Exported bootstrap plugin capabilities (PR #4311)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, addressing various features and fixes:

1. PR #4308 by harshal247 adds an API endpoint for querying trace data (ELI2-234).

2. PR #4311 by michavie exports bootstrap plugin capabilities.

3. PR #4307 by tcm390 fixes GUI issues related to missing requirement indicators and tooltips that occurred after a merge conflict.

4. PR #4323 by HarshModi2005 adds functionality for Default Agents based on the organization.

5. PR #4314 by 0xbbjoker fixes operation name tracking.

6. PR #4320 by paoloanzn adds a new feature to delete tweets with the deleteTweet() function.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From April 17-18, 2025, there were 6 new pull requests with 5 merged, 1 new issue, and 11 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (April 18-19, 2025) with 7 new pull requests, 10 merged PRs, 3 new issues, and 15 active contributors. This represents growth in both contributions and contributor participation.
sources: From 2025-04-17 to 2025-04-18, elizaos/eliza had 6 new PRs (5 merged), 1 new issues, and 11 active contributors.
From 2025-04-18 to 2025-04-19, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (10 merged), 3 new issues, and 15 active contributors.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Two recent issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4309 was opened by user wtfsayo, reporting a problem that was tested on a physical Ubuntu machine rather than a virtual machine. The issue title indicates this was to verify if the problem occurs in a non-virtualized environment.

2. Issue #4315 was opened by user Titan-Node, reporting that group chat functionality is not working in V2 of the application.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
